page.title: 17TOURISM
page.content: During the past few years, tourism has increased dramatically, due, to a large extent, to the popularity of the James Herriot 'Vet' books and the subsequent television series. Tourists, known locally as 'visitors', are catered for by several small, private hotels and public houses, bed and breakfast accommodation and camping and caravan sites. The main attraction is the scenery and the open countryside which provides good walking and hiking. Visitors are also interested in aspects of local life and history, including the site of the Roman fort above Bainbridge, the stocks on the Green and the renovated water-mill. Most visitors come by private car (including many from Europe, especially the Netherlands), but the number of coaches has increased recently.
